Describing antifa as an organization is incredibly misleading. Most of these black-clad protesters are strangers, bound together by a tactic
A lot of those people would describe themselves as anarchists, socialists, or anti-fascist before they'd call themselves "antifa".
People seem to think antifa is an organization like the Oath Keepers, or a leftist 'proud boys'. It's not. You are seeing black bloc tactics
It is still odd to me that you would say "I am not a fascist, but these anti-fascists are my enemies" - but there you are.
Because of that- they assume their opponents are the same antifa as their greek predecessors. There are some connections, sure, but tenuous.
Matthew Heimbach, Nathan Damigo, and Identity Evropa: organizers of Berkeley and Charlottesville draw a lot from Golden Dawn
the term antifa comes from europe and particularly Greece, where anti-fascists have been fighting far-right Golden Dawn

antifa, like "anarchist" is a political designation

black bloc is a tacting based around masking up and taking direct action in the street

Watching SuperBad. Really funny, so far. I wish I could see it in the theater though.

Browsing Flickr's "What's in your bag" flickr group. This makes me really happy- I dunno why.

Going to sleep to Harry Potter again. Such good stuff. =] Starting to have second thoughts about my mall trip tomorrow. Perhaps another day.
Tired, looking at Sidekick stuff at Amazon. I can get a battery, and two cases for less than $30? Sweet.
Watching mythbusters, and hanging out. I want to hang out with some people at the mall tomorrow. =|
Just took a magnificent shower. Feeling great, actually.

posts.title: Owning My Cloudinary Photos
